issue.title: [ENH] Partially replace `pd.Int64Index` with `pd.Index`

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->

Partially addresses #2332.

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->

I have replaced `pd.Int64Index` with `pd.Index` only in obvious and harmless places. More complicated like `VALID_INDEX_TYPES` in `sktime.utils.validation.series` are left for another ambitious PR.

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?

<!--
If your contribution does add a new hard dependency, we may suggest to initially develop your contribution in a separate companion package in https://github.com/sktime/ to keep external dependencies of the core sktime package to a minimum.
-->

No

#### PR checklist

Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [X] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.
- [X] The PR title starts with either [ENH], [DOC] or [BUG] indicating wether the PR topic is related to enhancement, documentation or bug

issue.title: [ENH] add new argument return_tags to all_estimators

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
<!--
-->
Closes #2387


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
-->
I have added a new argument 'return_tags' to the registry function all_estimators().  'return_tags' is an optional argument, either a str or list of str of tag names the user wants returned for all estimators returned.  If provided all_estimators will return each estimator's value for each tag in 'return_tags' or else None if the estimator doesn't have that tag.  I also added a new test to ensure all_estimators works if 'return_tags' is passed as a str or list of str. (the default - None is tested in other tests!)

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?

<!--
-->
No

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

<!-- 
 -->
Does this address the issue suggested?  Any test cases I should add?  Any other feedback?  (This is my first Pull Request so please let me know if I should be doing something differently!) 

#### Any other comments?
<!--
-->
Thank you for reviewing my PR!  Excited to be making my first contribution to sktime, hope this small change is useful! :)

#### PR checklist
<!--
Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

##### For all contributions
- [x] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [x] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.
- [x] The PR title starts with either [ENH], [DOC] or [BUG] indicating whether the PR topic is related to enhancement, documentation or bug


<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->

issue.title: [BUG] Windows fatal exception: access violation sktime/benchmarking/tests/test_evaluator.py::test_plots

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
`sktime/benchmarking/tests/test_evaluator.py::test_plots` fails with  `Windows fatal exception: access violation`

The line where error surfaces is:
`sktime\benchmarking\evaluation.py::plot_boxplots#145`
`fig, ax = plt.subplots(1)`

Solution:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69786885/after-conda-update-python-kernel-crashes-when-matplotlib-is-used

downgrade freetype from conda to 2.10.4

`conda install freetype=2.10.4`

**To Reproduce**
````
pytest sktime/benchmarking/tests/test_evaluator.py::test_plots

sktime/benchmarking/tests/test_evaluator.py::test_plots Windows fatal exception: access violation
````
**To Debug**
```python
import pytest
pytest.main(["-v", "sktime/benchmarking/tests/test_evaluator.py::test_plots"])

```

**Expected behavior**
Test passes

**Additional context**
freetype=2.11.0 (anaconda)

**Versions**
Windows, python 3.{7 8 9}

body:
The line that is crashing is:

```
2022-04-01T14:40:00.2124360Z Current thread 0x000070000b0ea000 (most recent call first):
2022-04-01T14:40:00.2127900Z   File "/Users/runner/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.12/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/backends/backend_macosx.py", line 69 in __init__
2022-04-01T14:40:00.2129460Z   File "/Users/runner/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.12/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/backend_bases.py", line 3500 in new_figure_manager_given_figure
2022-04-01T14:40:00.2131560Z   File "/Users/runner/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.12/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/backend_bases.py", line 3494 in new_figure_manager
2022-04-01T14:40:00.2133030Z   File "/Users/runner/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.12/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py", line 306 in new_figure_manager
2022-04-01T14:40:00.2134950Z   File "/Users/runner/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.12/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py", line 790 in figure
2022-04-01T14:40:00.2136340Z   File "/Users/runner/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.12/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py", line 1434 in subplots
2022-04-01T14:40:00.2137720Z   File "/Users/runner/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.12/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sktime/benchmarking/evaluation.py", line 145 in plot_boxplots
2022-04-01T14:40:00.2139230Z   File "/Users/runner/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.12/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sktime/benchmarking/tests/test_evaluator.py", line 194 in test_plots
```

related to [matplotlib#21788 segfault](https://github.com/matplotlib/matplotlib/issues/21788) and [matplotlib#19769 memory leak](https://github.com/matplotlib/matplotlib/issues/19769)

No solution yet.
Hm, should we skip, or perhaps better, xfail the test?

issue.title: [MNT] xfail known sporadic test failure #2368

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This adds a test xfail of the known sporadic test failure reported as  bug #2368.

The cause of the bug is not known, and the skip is added to avoid sporadic test crashes unrelated to the addition.

body:
Maybe related:
My current [PR](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2991) has been failing the github CI tests for the same version (Mac python 3.7) for a bug which I think might be related ```2022-07-18T07:52:44.9856430Z =========================== short test summary info ============================
2022-07-18T07:52:44.9856740Z FAILED sktime/utils/plotting.py::sktime.utils.plotting.plot_lags```

It passes local test on my linux py3.9 machine, and also passes github CI tests for all other os/versions.

issue.title: [ENH] Changes to CNN Classifier

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->
Fixes #2935 


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->
- [ ] Moving the `convert_y_to_keras` function in `BaseDeepClassifier` into a utils function
- [x] Enable returning the `label_encoder` and `one hot encoder` to the user from `convert_y_to_keras` (it can be useful for the users in case they want to use it to encode other data / or to decode data later on)
- [x] Add option to have multiple linear layers in output layer / different activation function. Also add the `use_bias` parameter to output layer. (simply as a customisation option to users, multiple linear layers are useful to create deeper networks depending on dataset / choice of activation function)
- [x] option to choose optimiser (usually its Adam but just for customisation's sake we can give this as option as well). Also should allow specifying `lr` either within the optimiser or as parameter to the class itself.
- [x] Accept parameter as input in `CNNClassifier` to specify `random seed`
- [ ] Train/fit the model on GPU depending on users choice (maybe take an input parameter for this as well)
- [x] Option to view / return the loss of fit (either as a graph or simply as a list / array )

##### For all contributions
- [x] The PR title starts with either [ENH], [MNT], [DOC], or [BUG] indicating whether the PR topic is related to enhancement, maintenance, documentation, or bug.

<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->
